question: Which is not identified as a stage of development in T.H. Marshall's analysis of citizenship in England?
explanation: T.H. Marshall analysed the conept of citizenship in an evolutionary perspective and identified three stages of development of the rights associated with citizenship in England since Eighteenth century. At the first stage, civil rights were evolved in the eighteenth century which include equality before the law, liberty of a person, etc. At the second stage, political rights were evolved in the nineteenth century which include right to take part in the elections, etc. At the third stage, social rights were developed in the twentieth century which include right economic and social welfare, etc.
